answerText: bile [10] This structure controls the flow of bile and other digestive juices through the ampulla of Vater from the gallbladder into the duodenum.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | University of Illinois A and Missouri State A and University of South Carolina A | 18 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Canaliculi receive this substance from the hepatocytes in which it forms and pass it on through its namesake ducts to the intestines.  [10] Name this digestive juice that helps dissolve fats, an excess of which can cause jaundice.
